@@ -0,0 +1,116 @@
+from .batchnorm import _BatchNorm
+from .. import functional as F
+
+
+class LayerNorm(_BatchNorm):
+    r"""Applies Layer Normalization over a mini-batch of inputs as described in
+    the paper `Layer Normalization`_ .
+
+    .. math::
+        y = \frac{x - mean[x]}{ \sqrt{Var[x]} + \epsilon} * gamma + beta
+
+    The mean and standard-deviation are calculated separately for all dimensions
body: From the way the original paper describes the concept and formulates LN, LN normalizes all inputs to a layer. So it's across dimensions. tf.contrib implementation also agrees on this https://www.tensorflow.org/api_docs/python/tf/contrib/layers/layer_norm. That said, it is not quite clear what LN does when input has channels/planes (e.g. images) since it makes more sense to have it behave like IN. @Kaixhin and I had a discussion on this, and we hoped to get a concrete answer from the author. Unfortunately, we haven't heard back.
